page.title: 02 Beccles Common
page.content: The Common used to belong to the Abbey of Bury St Edmunds.In 1540 Henry VIII granted Beccles Fen to William Rede and the people of Beccles for the payment of $126.A charter by Queen Elizabeth I in 1584 gave the 140 acres to be administered by a Port Reeve and a common council of 36 members. It is still a beautiful area covered with trees and bushes and surrounded by fencing.To enter the area you must cross a cattle grid which keeps in the 8 cows allowed to graze. In the war it was used as a training ground by the Home Guard and there is still an old pill box used by children to play on. There is a 9 hole golf course and a very small clubhouse. Many people use the common to walk their dogs and children play on the adventure playground.
